notable_quotes.context: Threat after accused refused him alms when begging

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Demenge le Clerc dit Mandray
notable_quotes.french: qu'il ne se donneroit guerre de peine d'en afire venir une par devant son lict et la feroit deshabiller tout nue mais qu'il seroit plus honteux qu'elle
notable_quotes.context: Accused's alleged boast about being able to bring a naked woman before his bed

notable_quotes.speaker: Mathillon veuve Jean Piarion
notable_quotes.french: honne de bonne recouvrance, que quand on avoit necessité de luy pour guarir quelques enffans ou bestes il estoit assez tost prest
notable_quotes.context: Witness testimony praising accused's readiness to help heal children or animals

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolle femme Nicolas le petit Nicolas
notable_quotes.french: et sy on eut heu affaire de luy a minuit il eut secouru les personnes
notable_quotes.context: Witness testimony praising accused's willingness to help people even at midnight

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Benifosse
notable_quotes.french: par fois il en estoit hay du peuple, parce qu'il prevoioit que mal arriveroit
notable_quotes.context: Witness testimony about accused's predictions of crop failures and how people sometimes hated him for foreseeing bad things

material_culture.context: Purchased from accused for horses of soldiers billeted during previous wars
Multiple witnesses owed accused money they could not pay
Accused said beggar should be given a beating with a stick
Used rope to escape down from walls of town
Accused predicted dearth of these crops at 'corraille'

spatial_references.context: Home of Valentin le Souche who made accusation
Home of Colas Anthoine, named as accomplice
Home of Dediel wife of Ydoult Willaumé, named as accomplice
Birthplace of accused and his mother
Where accused worked as laboureur for 42 years after marriage
Location of court; accused went there seeking people who could remedy sick animals
Where Colas Jeannel had 'evil meeting' with accused before accident
Place where accused made predictions about crop failures

historical_context.military_details: During previous wars soldiers were billeted on witnesses; witness Phelice bought oats from accused for soldiers' horses
economic_hardship_indicators: multiple witnesses unable to pay debts
accused predicted dearth of grain, beans, hay
accused said it was bad year because reaped less than sown

legal_context.redress_outcome: Refused to make reparation to Claudette Thierry for calling her witch
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Initially held prisoner in house; escaped by climbing over two roofs and using rope to descend from town walls

emotional_state_notes: sans s'estonner aulcunement de telles menaces (showed no fear of torture threats)

third_parties.name: Claudette Thierry
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: quarrel - accused called her witch, threatened to have her burned
third_parties.context: Previously executed witch with whom accused had quarrel

third_parties.name: Barbelline
third_parties.context: Mother of boy killed by lightning; husband also injured

third_parties.name: husband of Barbelline
third_parties.context: Injured during thunderstorm when son was killed

third_parties.name: Colas Jeannel
third_parties.context: Had accident with tree after 'evil meeting' with accused; still bedridden

third_parties.name: Girardin Didier Masson
third_parties.context: Husband told to pay debt to accused

third_parties.name: lad who served at Raurux
third_parties.context: According to accused, this person (not accused) had boasted 50 years earlier about bringing naked woman to bed

economic_context.details: Multiple witnesses owed accused money they could not pay, particularly for oats during wars; witness 1 feared accused because of unpaid debt; witness 19 lost animals while owing debt for oats. Accused's goods were confiscated when banished, later recovered when released.

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial notable for accused's escape and voluntary return; unusual outcome of release after formal charges. Strong defensive evidence from community witnesses. Prosecutor Rémy appears to have gone through formalities but court ultimately released accused. Several witness testimonies damaged/missing (numbers 7, 11, 15, 20, 21). Accused practiced veterinary healing and was well-regarded in community despite some predictions of crop failures that made him unpopular. Trial occurred during time of economic hardship and military presence.
